intro: Odontarrhena hirta, commonly known as the hairy odontarrhena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Odontarrhena hirta is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in regions with limited water availability.
